title: How to Make Homemade Peeps

steps.headline: Whisk together only 1/2 of the cold water with the 2 packets of unflavored gelatin powder.
steps.description: After 2-3 minutes of whisking, set the bowl aside.

steps.headline: Before you start to mix anything else, spray your peeps mold pan and set that aside as well.
steps.description: Find a medium-sized bowl and mix the rest of the 1/4 cup of water, 1/2 cup of light corn syrup, 1 pinch of salt, and the 3/4 cup of white sugar.

steps.headline: Heat the mixture over medium heat until it reaches 240° F.  Then remove it from the heat.
steps.description: Put it back into the medium-sized bowl and continue to mix (use a mixer)this time you're going to add the mixture of cold water and the 2 packets of gelatin powder together, set the mixer on high and mix for 10-12 minutes, make sure to mix until the mixture is lukewarm and fluffy. take a spoon and fill up the peep molds. (Or if it's easier, use a piping bag if you're going to use a piping bag make sure to scrape the mixture into the piping bag immediately, then fill the molds).

steps.headline: Let the peeps sit for 10-15 minutes.
steps.description: After letting them sit, gently and carefully remove the peeps. Use the 1/2 cup of colored sanding sugar to roll the peeps in. To add faces use and melt the 1 tablespoon of chocolate chips, after melting the chocolate chips put the melted chocolate into a small plastic bag, use scissors and cut a small piece off the corner of the bag, (Use the corner of the bag to make the peep's face).

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: A batch of homemade peeps make great Easter/Christmas gifts! Give a thumbs up if it helped!

text: Whisk together only 1/2 of the cold water with the 2 packets of unflavored gelatin powder. After 2-3 minutes of whisking, set the bowl aside. Before you start to mix anything else, spray your peeps mold pan and set that aside as well. Find a medium-sized bowl and mix the rest of the 1/4 cup of water, 1/2 cup of light corn syrup, 1 pinch of salt, and the 3/4 cup of white sugar. Heat the mixture over medium heat until it reaches 240° F.  Then remove it from the heat. Put it back into the medium-sized bowl and continue to mix (use a mixer)this time you're going to add the mixture of cold water and the 2 packets of gelatin powder together, set the mixer on high and mix for 10-12 minutes, make sure to mix until the mixture is lukewarm and fluffy. take a spoon and fill up the peep molds. (Or if it's easier, use a piping bag if you're going to use a piping bag make sure to scrape the mixture into the piping bag immediately, then fill the molds). Let the peeps sit for 10-15 minutes. After letting them sit, gently and carefully remove the peeps. Use the 1/2 cup of colored sanding sugar to roll the peeps in. To add faces use and melt the 1 tablespoon of chocolate chips, after melting the chocolate chips put the melted chocolate into a small plastic bag, use scissors and cut a small piece off the corner of the bag, (Use the corner of the bag to make the peep's face). Serve and enjoy! A batch of homemade peeps make great Easter/Christmas gifts! Give a thumbs up if it helped!
